0512LV006-d-05-10-12-UP.Narrative: YBM21R-10 HAD 46 CARS AND WAS SHOVING EAST IN TRACK 207 WHEN A CUT OF 17 CARS SEPARATED AND ROLLED OUT THE EAST END OF TRACK 207 IMPACTING THE SIDE OF THE LLG12-10 WHICH WAS DOUBLED OUT ON THE LEAD FROM TRACK 204.  THE CREW HAD COUPLED A CUT OF 29 CARS, WHICH HAD BEEN PULLED FROM THE BOWL INTO A CUTOF 17 CARS WHICH HAD BEEN SECURED AT THAT LOCATION BY THE INBOUND LLB06-09.  THE REMOTE OPERATOR WAS AT THE JOINT WHEN HE COUPLED AND STRETCHED FOR 115 FEET BEFORE SHOVING THE TRACK.  THE CARS SEPARATED AT THE LOCATION THE INITIAL JOINT HAD BEEN MADE.  UPON COMPLETION OF INVESTIGATION, CAUSE COULDNOT BE DETERMINED.  THE ENGINE DOWNLOAD AND VIDEO DOWNLOAD SHOWS A GOOD JOINT AND STRETCH WAS MADE ON EQUIPMENT BEFORE THE SHOVE WAS MADE.  MECHANICAL MADE AN INSPECTION ON COUPLERS AND FOUND NO EXCEPTIONS TO INTERNAL PARTS.  TRACK INSPECTION WAS MADE AND THERE WERE NO EXCEPTIONS TAKEN TO TRACK.

SAIT CONTRACTOR, PAC RAIL, WAS LINING POWER AND UTILIZING 400/500 LEAD.  SWITCH APPEARED TO BE PROPERLY LINED, AND AS CREWPROCEEDED PAST THE SWITCH AND UPON CONDUCTING A REVERSE MOVEMENT, THE LOCOMOTIVE DERAILED AND MOVEMENT CEASED. I052312-d-05-23-12-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Other way and structure defect (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I052312-d-05-23-12-PATH.Contributing Accident Cause: Other causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I052312-d-05-23-12-PATH.Accident Cause: Other way and structure defect (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I052312-d-05-23-12-PATH.Narrative:
AT 1514 HOURS, A SINGLE PA-5 CAR UNIT (5614) WAS BEING MOVED OUT OF THE WHEEL TRUING BUILDING AT THEHARRISON CAR MAINTENANCE FACILITY (HCMF).  AT THE TIME OF THE MOVEMENT, THE EAST END DOOR ON THE SHOP BUILDING WAS NOT IN THE FULLY OPENED POSITION.  OPERATED BY ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN G. ORRICO, FROM THE NO. 1 CAB  OF 5614, THE CAR PROCEEDED EASTWARD ON TRACK 5.  AS THE CAR ENTERED THE EAST END DOORWAY, THE TOP OF THE CAR BONNET CAME INTO CONTACT WITH THE LOWER SECTION OF THE DOOR.  THE DOOR AND DOOR OPERATING MECHANISM WERE DAMAGED; THE BONNET ON CAR 5614 SUSTAINED DAMAGE.  

DAMAGE TO THE HCMFBUILDING DOOR AND STRUCTURE IS ESTIMATED TO BE $13,500.00.  CAR EQUIPMENT DAMAGE TO CAR 5614 IS ESTIMATED TO BE $44,580.18.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT.

SYSTEM SAFETY ANDENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (SS&EM) HAS INVESTIGATED THIS INCIDENT.  THROUGH A VISUAL INSPECTION AT THESCENE, DISCUSSIONS WITH THE INTERNATIONAL DOOR, INC. MAINTENANCE TEAM, THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN, ANDPERSONNEL IN THE WHEEL TRUING BUILDING, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE EAST DOOR IN THE WHEEL TRUING BUILDING DID NOT FULLY OPEN AS DESIGNED WHEN ACTIVATED.    IT HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED WHY THIS OCCURRED.  THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN ACTIVATED THE OPEN BUTTON ON THE CONTROL CONSOLE, AND THEN PROCEEDED TOPERFORM AN UNDERCAR INSPECTION OF CAR 5614, ENSURING THAT THERE WAS NO HANGING EQUIPMENT OR OBSTRUCTIONS ON TRACK 5.

THE 46TH CAR PICKED THE SWITCH AND DERAILED, CAUSING THE 45TH AND 46TH CARS TO ALSO DERAIL.

0512RS020-d-05-31-12-UP.Narrative: BNSF REQUESTED PERMISSION TO ENTER YARD FROM YARDMASTER.  YARDMASTER GIVES PERMISSION TO ENTER, LANDTRAIN IN 9 AND TELLS THE BNSF CREW TO TALK TO THE 41R ABOUT GETTING THEIR POWER OUT OF 9 TO GET TO8 TO HEAD BACK.  THE 41R TOLD THEM THEY WERE OK TO MAKE THEIR MOVE FROM 9 TO 8 "AS LONG AS YOU DON'TFOUL THE LEAD".  THE BNSF CREW PULLED DOWN PAST THE FOULING POINT OF THE BULL SWITCH, WITHOUT LINING IT, AND INTO THE ACTIVE RCL ZONE 3.  THE YST41R WAS PULLING THEIR CUT AND WE ENDED UP WITH A  SIDESWIPE DERAILMENT.  BNSF DERAILED ONE LOCOMOTIVE.  RCL ZONE WAS ESTABLISHED AT 2327 AND HAD NEVER DROPPED.  BNSF EST EQUIP DAMAGE: $19,000
